intro: Hypelate dentata, commonly known as the toothed hypelate, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
